solution_line_template: Rick has one less than {olga_stripes_per_shoe} stripes, or {olga_stripes_per_shoe}-{rick_less_stripes}={rick_stripes_per_shoe} stripes on each tennis shoe.

Hortense has double the {olga_stripes_per_shoe} stripes that Olga has, or a total of {olga_stripes_per_shoe}*{double_factor}=<<{olga_stripes_per_shoe}*{double_factor}={hortense_stripes_per_shoe}>>{hortense_stripes_per_shoe} stripes per shoe.

Since each of them has {shoes_per_pair} tennis shoes per pair, then the total number of stripes on all of their shoes is {shoes_per_pair}*({olga_stripes_per_shoe}+{rick_stripes_per_shoe}+{hortense_stripes_per_shoe})=<<{shoes_per_pair}*({olga_stripes_per_shoe}+{rick_stripes_per_shoe}+{hortense_stripes_per_shoe})={total_stripes}>>{total_stripes} stripes
